alert.note: Alert for Municipality of Skagway (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued December 23 at 6:17AM AKST until December 24 at 5:00PM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...SIGNIFICANT SNOWFALL FOR PARTS OF SE AK THROUGH CHRISTMAS... Multiple frontal bands will pass over the panhandle through the weekend bringing periods of snow. The first band on Friday will start with light, dry, snow tracking northward across the area. The snow will become wetter over the southern panhandle. A break or decrease in snowfall rates will occur before the second frontal band tracks northward into the southern panhandle early Saturday. This front will bring another round of snow and a chance of freezing rain. The south will change to all rain while the north sees snow tapering off or mixing with freezing rain Saturday night. ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM AKST SATURDAY... ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 9 AM AKST SATURDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 8 to 12 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. For the Wind Chill Advisory, cold wind chills as low as 35 below zero near White Pass. * WHERE...Municipality of Skagway and Klondike Highway. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, from noon today to 9 AM AKST Saturday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, until 5 PM AKST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult with reduced visibility in blowing snow. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snowfall rates will peak late Friday night. Additional light snow is likely Saturday afternoon and again Sunday night.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
